conclusion: Ensure block A remains stationary relative to block B when force F is applied to block B.
Force F should not exceed maximum static friction force between blocks A and B.
Block A is stacked on block B, which is on the ground. Force F is applied horizontally to block B.
Weight of block A is 10 N.
Maximum static friction force between A and B is 1 N.
Weight of block B is 20 N.
Normal force exerted by the ground on block B is 30 N.
Kinetic friction force between block B and the ground is 3 N.
Net force acting on block B should be less than or equal to maximum static friction force to keep A stationary.
Net force acting on block B when F is applied is F - 3 N.
Condition for keeping block A stationary is F - 3 N ≤ 1 N.
Final answer: Force F should not exceed 4 N to keep blocks A and B relatively stationary.
